intro: Sceletium framesii, commonly known as Kanna, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant contains various psychoactive compounds, including kanna alkaloids, which contribute to its traditional use in rituals and as a mild stimulant. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its unique chemical composition and cultural significance, it has attracted interest in both botanical and pharmacological research.
